meanings.definition: The act or instance of placing two or more things side by side.
meanings.sent1: The juxtapositional of the red and blue flowers created a beautiful contrast.
meanings.sent2: The artist used a clever juxtapositional of colors in the painting.
meanings.sent3: The juxtapositional of the cat and the dog sleeping together was quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: The juxtapositional of the old and new buildings symbolized the city's history.
meanings.sent5: The juxtapositional of the sweet and sour flavors made the dish unforgettable.

meanings.definition: The state of being close together or side by side.
meanings.sent1: The juxtapositional of the two houses made it easy for the neighbors to chat.
meanings.sent2: The juxtapositional of the chairs in the room allowed for easy conversation.
meanings.sent3: The juxtapositional of the siblings in the family photo was heartwarming.
meanings.sent4: The juxtapositional of the mountains against the sky was breathtaking.
meanings.sent5: The juxtapositional of the books on the shelf made it look organized.

meanings.definition: The relationship between two or more things placed close together.
meanings.sent1: The juxtapositional of the characters in the story added depth to the plot.
meanings.sent2: The juxtapositional of the elements in the experiment affected the outcome.
meanings.sent3: The juxtapositional of the flavors in the dish made it taste unique.
meanings.sent4: The juxtapositional of the different art styles showcased the artist's versatility.
meanings.sent5: The juxtapositional of the colors in the design made it visually appealing.
